bug.author: ashishsiyag
bug.summary: building mlpack from source failed while accessing 'guess_file_type_internal' from 'arma::disko'
bug.description: build % make [ 0%] Updating arma_config.hpp (if necessary) [ 0%] Built target mlpack_arma_config Moving header files to include/mlpack/ [ 0%] Built target mlpack_headers [ 1%] Building CXX object src/mlpack/CMakeFiles/mlpack.dir/core/data/load.cpp.o In file included from /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/src/mlpack/core/data/load.cpp:13: /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/src/mlpack/core/data/load_impl.hpp:124:30: error: 'guess_file_type_internal' is a private member of 'arma::diskio' loadType = arma::diskio::guess_file_type_internal(stream); ^ /usr/local/include/armadillo_bits/diskio_bones.hpp:49:37: note: declared private here inline arma_cold static file_type guess_file_type_internal(std::istream& f); ^ In file included from /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/src/mlpack/core/data/load.cpp:13: /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/src/mlpack/core/data/load_impl.hpp:192:32: error: 'guess_file_type_internal' is a private member of 'arma::diskio' loadType = arma::diskio::guess_file_type_internal(stream); ^ /usr/local/include/armadillo_bits/diskio_bones.hpp:49:37: note: declared private here inline arma_cold static file_type guess_file_type_internal(std::istream& f); ^ 2 errors generated. make[2]: *** [src/mlpack/CMakeFiles/mlpack.dir/core/data/load.cpp.o] Error 1 make[1]: *** [src/mlpack/CMakeFiles/mlpack.dir/all] Error 2 make: *** [all] Error 2 How can this be resolved ?

the associated bug fix is in this PR: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2597>#2597</denchmark-link>

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/conradsnicta>@conradsnicta</denchmark-link> ; I'm in the process of resurrecting the other PR you suggested there, hopefully that will be open later today (currently debugging a test). <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashishsiyag>@ashishsiyag</denchmark-link> you could either apply that PR to your branch, or another workaround would be to use an older version of Armadillo.

while executing my 'cmake ../' I am getting such response, previously I installed go 1.15, now uninstalled and installed 1.11.0, still it is unable to find go and various other files. how to get them resolved ? build % cmake ../ -- cotire 1.7.10 loaded. -- Found Ensmallen: /usr/local/include (found suitable version "2.14.0", minimum required is "2.10.0") -- Could NOT find OpenMP_C (missing: OpenMP_C_FLAGS OpenMP_C_LIB_NAMES) -- Could NOT find OpenMP_CXX (missing: OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS OpenMP_CXX_LIB_NAMES) -- Could NOT find OpenMP (missing: OpenMP_C_FOUND OpenMP_CXX_FOUND) CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:582 (message): txt2man not found; man pages will not be generated. -- Not building Markdown bindings. -- Not building Python bindings. -- Go not found: Found unsuitable version "", but required is at least "1.11.0" (found /usr/local/bin/go) -- Gonum not found (missing: GONUM_VERSION_STRING) -- Not building Go bindings; the following modules are not available: - Go - Gonum -- Could NOT find R_roxygen2 (missing: R_ROXYGEN2) -- Could NOT find R_Rcpp (missing: R_RCPP) -- Could NOT find R_RcppArmadillo (missing: R_RCPPARMADILLO) -- Could NOT find R_RcppEnsmallen (missing: R_RCPPENSMALLEN) -- Could NOT find R_BH (missing: R_BH) -- Could NOT find R_testthat (missing: R_TESTTHAT) -- Not building R bindings, Following modules are not available: - roxygen2 - Rcpp - RcppArmadillo - RcppEnsmallen - BH - testthat -- Could NOT find Doxygen (missing: DOXYGEN_EXECUTABLE) -- Configuring done -- Generating done -- Build files have been written to: /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/build

It looks like the configuration still succeeds. If you're not intending to build the Go bindings, you don't need to worry about those messages. If you are intending to build the Go bindings, can you provide the outputs of /usr/local/bin/go version?
siyagashish@Ashishs-MacBook-Air bin % /usr/local/bin/go version go version go1.15 darwin/amd64
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> I intend to work on issue 2592 , so before starting with it, I wanted to get mlpack running on my system.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashishsiyag>@ashishsiyag</denchmark-link> in that case, I wouldn't worry about the Go bindings---you shouldn't need them for development.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashishsiyag>@ashishsiyag</denchmark-link> , since you would be working on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/2592>#2592</denchmark-link> I don't think go bindings are necessary just run a sample program to check if everything else is good And rest you are good to go Welcome to the community

Sorry to keep bothering you, running make mlpack_test builds successfully but running the tests bin/mlpack_test returns error. siyagashish@Ashishs-MacBook-Air build % make mlpack_test [ 0%] Updating arma_config.hpp (if necessary) [ 0%] Built target mlpack_arma_config Moving header files to include/mlpack/ [ 0%] Built target mlpack_headers [ 34%] Built target mlpack [100%] Built target mlpack_test siyagashish@Ashishs-MacBook-Air build % bin/mlpack_test -t KNNTest Test setup error: no test cases matching filter or all test cases were disabled siyagashish@Ashishs-MacBook-Air build % bin/mlpack_test Running 1256 test cases... unknown location:0: fatal error: in "AsyncLearningTest/OneStepQLearningTest": memory access violation at address: 0x11105693a: non-existent physical address /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/src/mlpack/tests/async_learning_test.cpp:37: last checkpoint: "OneStepQLearningTest" test entry *** 1 failure is detected in the test module "mlpackTest"

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashishsiyag>@ashishsiyag</denchmark-link> , Please refer <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2572#issuecomment-678107849>#2572 (comment)</denchmark-link> , We recently had some changes with test <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2572#issuecomment-678107849>#2572 (comment)</denchmark-link>
you can run ./bin/mlpack_catch_test "[KNNTest]" also about the second issue, can you run 2-3 times to check if that happens every time , I think it is a random failure, Also The are some memory access violation possible , We have a issue open for that : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/2386>#2386</denchmark-link>

I deleted the build repo, created new dir build, $ mkdir build $ cd build $ cmake ../ -- Configuring done -- Generating done -- Build files have been written to: /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/build $ make mlpack_knn -j1' [100%] Built target mlpack Scanning dependencies of target mlpack_knn [100%] Building CXX object src/mlpack/methods/neighbor_search/CMakeFiles/mlpack_knn.dir/knn_main.cpp.o [100%] Linking CXX executable ../../../../bin/mlpack_knn [100%] Built target mlpack_knn $ make mlpack_test [100%] Linking CXX executable ../../../bin/mlpack_test [100%] Built target mlpack_test $ bin/mlpack_test -t KNNTest Test setup error: no test cases matching filter or all test cases were disabled Then I tried with other method logistic regression $ make mlpack_logistic_regression [100%] Linking CXX executable ../../../../bin/mlpack_logistic_regression [100%] Built target mlpack_logistic_regression $ bin/mlpack_test -t LogisticRegressionMainTest Running 19 test cases... unknown location:0: fatal error: in "LogisticRegressionMainTest/LRNoResponses": memory access violation at address: 0x10930393a: non-existent physical address /Users/siyagashish/Desktop/open-source/mlpack-3.4.0/src/mlpack/tests/main_tests/logistic_regression_test.cpp:68: last checkpoint: "LRNoResponses" test entry *** 1 failure is detected in the test module "mlpackTest" I don't how to resolve this, now I am trying to install mlpack to the system and run it through a program, see if that works.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashishsiyag>@ashishsiyag</denchmark-link> please read the above comment and linked comment we migrated some of the test from boost to catch bin/mlpack_test -t KNNTest is wrong And knn is in not in mlpack_test it's in mlpack_catch_test , mlpack_catcg_test are all test written in catch where is the other one is boost So please build make mlpack_catch_test and then run bin/mlpack_catch_test "[KNNTest]"

siyagashish@Ashishs-MacBook-Air build % bin/mlpack_catch_test "[KNNTest]" mlpack version: mlpack 3.4.0 armadillo version: 9.900.3 (Nocturnal Misbehaviour) zsh: bus error bin/mlpack_catch_test "[KNNTest]" <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jeffin143>@jeffin143</denchmark-link> can you help me with this?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had any recent activity. It will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions! üëç
